paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted genetic variant information for the TTR gene, including penetrance data for affected and unaffected carriers.

patients.demographics: Predominantly male (71.4%), mean age at symptom onset 56.3 years.
patients.phenotype: Symptomatic patients with various phenotypes including predominantly cardiac and predominantly neurologic.

functional_data.summary: The Val30Met variant is associated with a high penetrance of ATTR amyloidosis.

variants.population_frequency: Common in specific populations, particularly in South America.
variants.evidence_level: Strong evidence for pathogenicity based on clinical data.
variants.additional_notes: Val30Met is the most common genotype in symptomatic patients.
key_quotes: Val30Met was the most common genotype in symptomatic patients in South America (80.9%), Europe (55.4%), and Asia (50.5%).
In asymptomatic gene carriers, mean (SD) age at enrollment was 42.4 (15.7) years, 42.4% were male, and 73.2% carried the Val30Met mutation.

tables_processed.table_caption: Demographics of symptomatic patients according to genotype category
Demographics of asymptomatic gene carriers according to genotype category

extraction_metadata.notes: Data was extracted thoroughly from the main text and tables.
